title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS — In a defensive masterclass that transformed a potential playoff preview into a one-man showcase, the Indiana Pacers dismantled the Orlando Magic, 107-81, on the strength of a historic and utterly dominant performance from Reggie Miller.

From the opening tip, Miller was uncontainable, slicing through the Orlando defense with a breathtaking display of offensive firepower. He poured in a game-high 42 points, a staggering total that dwarfed the entire Magic starting lineup. Miller’s signature catch-and-shoot motion was a blur, and his ability to create space was nothing short of artistic. Every time Orlando threatened to build momentum, it was Miller who answered, draining a demoralizing three-pointer or converting a crucial and-one to silence the threat.

The game was effectively decided by Miller’s singular brilliance. While Rik Smits provided a solid 14-point, 10-rebound double-double and Dale Davis controlled the paint with 16 boards, they were supporting actors in the Reggie Miller show. The Magic, led by Nick Anderson's 17 points, simply had no counter. Indiana’s defense, feeding off Miller’s electric energy, locked down, holding Orlando to a paltry 81 points.

This was not merely a victory; it was a statement. On this night, Reggie Miller wasn't just the best player on the floor—he was an unstoppable force, authoring a performance for the ages and leading his Pacers to a resounding and memorable triumph.
